text: Can you please share the site url ? So i can check

Hello, we have a HubSpot page embded into out Twilio configuration to see the contacts and we are getting a `There was a problem loading this page.` and also in console getting
```react-dom.production.min.js:189 DOMException: Failed to read a named property 'chatspotSessionId' from 'Window': Blocked a frame with origin "<https://app.HubSpot.com>" from accessing a cross-origin frame.```
tryied embedding the iframe on a random page and still getting this issue, seems like some CSP missconfig, but not sure how to go about it

Anyone know if it’s possible to track numerical property changes in HS across multiple records?
The use case is: I have a “budget increased” field that can change over time. I’d like to track the total sum of budget increases over a period of time.

Displaying an iframe on your page is simple.  But then trying to read or manipulate the data inside the iframe is when the "cross-origin" problem appears.  I can't tell you the best way to fix it but I would search for "cross-origin in iframe CORS error" or similar on Google and you should find some articles explaining the issue.
You could build a summary report using the sum() function and put it on a dashboard.
thanks scote but how do i do it on the record?

Hmmm,  So I think I would create a 2nd field for holding the changes over time and create a workflow that watches for when the budget_increased field changes and when it does the workflow could increment the 2nd field accordingly.

Hello! I'm not sure where to post so I will start here. I'm having issues with updating my company's global footer. When I made some updates to our existing footer, the layout became jumbled. I went back and looked at the existing one and saw that this was actually already happening but hadn't been noticed. Essentially items are appearing in a different order than how they're set up in the editor.

I'm picking this up from a designer who is no longer with the company so I'm a bit new to HubSpot. Hoping someone can help me out!
As far as I've understood, the code of the global footer needs to be fixed. If you need coding related assistance, you're welcome to send me a dm.
new json fieldType just dropped: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties#property-type-and-fieldtype-values>

Seems limited though...

A text value stored as formatted JSON, used only for internal properties. Properties of this type cannot be created or edited, and are not visible in HubSpot.
agreed, I thought it was interesting that they would just now talk about it
Internal things usually become external facing after a little bit though, so that gives me hope
Just wondering what your best-use case is - where would you find this useful?  As a developer we use JSON all the time but for regular users seeing it in the record UI?  I dunno...
it's pretty nice as a store of data for crm cards
for things that don't fit the object nature of custom objects or the timeline nature of timeline events

<@U01QVR44MEY> Thanks for that.  If my clients didn't need to have Enterprise level I might use CRM cards and custom objects - we mostly have Pro-level customers atm - I will keep this in mind though when - and if - we can create our own with this data type
I dont understand "Properties of this type cannot be created or edited,"
Part of me was thinking this could be used as some type of "cache" solution for serverless

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
